questions.question: What's your Discord Username?
What's your e-mail?
What is your preferred name?
What is your preferred pronouns?
How are you at coming up with ideas?
answers: I get a unique idea almost everyday.
I come up with interesting ideas every now and then.
I am willing to learn idea development.
I do not expect to have an original thought.

questions.question: Do you have any further comments on idea-ing?
What's your 2D visual art skill level?
answers: I may as well be Picasso, Rambrandt, or Downing. I'm chilling.
I've made some art.
I'm willing to learn how to draw.
I can't tell a cat from a dog.

questions.question: Specifically, how good are you at digital art?
answers: I am a Deviantart diva, a Newgrounds numen, a Pinterest prince.
I can do some digital art things.
I'm willing to learn the ways of the Krita.
I have been permanently gimped out of using GIMP.

questions.question: What about 3D modeling/rendering
answers: I belong on the Blender Guru channel. No, I belong on the Corridor Crew.
I've made a scene, or an interesting object.
I'm on a journey of discovery, and I will take assistance.
My world exists on the plane. The flat plane.

questions.question: On a related note, how confident are you in animation?
answers: I'm my generation's Walt Disney. I'm going to change the animation world.
I've animated a short scene before.
I'd love to make animation, but I don't know how yet, or I'm overwhelmed.
I'm just overwhelmed. Nope.

questions.question: Do you have any further comments on visual arts?
How would you rate your musical ability?
answers: I'm John Williams, and I'm also first chair in his orchestra, as well as his mixing engineer.
I've done music-related things in my time.
I'm waiting for the right director.
I am literally tonedeaf.

questions.question: Can you write music?
answers: Like I said, I'm John Williams.
I've made a song before.
I'd like someone to Stand By Me while I learn.
I couldn't tell you what notes sound good together if you played them for me.

questions.question: What about performing music?
answers: I'm John Phillip Sousa himself. That's right, I invented low brass. Deal with it.
I can play at least one intstrument decently, or I used to before high school ended.
I'd love to learn, just give me an instrument and a teacher.
I wouldn't know what I note I was playing if I was playing it.

questions.question: How about electronic music production?
answers: Virtual Riot, I'm coming for you. Or whoever the top guy is nowadays.
I've used music making software before, I can do stuff with it.
I would be willing to have someone guide me in the mystical ways.
The ways are mystical alright.

questions.question: Do you have any further comments on music?
Would you consider yourself a writer?
answers: I have gone beyond even Tolkien. Fear my power.
I've done creative writing before, and I'd like to do more.
I'd love to learn how to get better.
Option 4.

questions.question: Do you have any further comments on writing?
Can you program?
answers: I'm a tech billionaire, with the exception of the billionaire part.
I've made some programs before. Who cares if they're finished..
I want to learn the lore. Give me the lore.
It's all Greek to me.

questions.question: Do you have any further comments on programming?
Do you consider yourself good at management?
answers: I can figure out what everyone is good at and put them in exactly the right place for everyone to succeed.
I can tell people what to do, and I can listen too.
I can manage if given a chance.
I am a push-over. No, literally, I don't have the mental strength to stay standing when tapped.

questions.question: Do you consider yourself good at vision-casting?
answers: I literally have a time machine. I know exactly what will happen and where to go.
I have great ideas but sometimes need help finding them.
I haven’t tried envisioning stuff much but I’d love to try!
I have never shown any vision since my eyes got stolen seven years ago.
